title: Everyday Situations
description: Practice connectors in real-life contexts: making plans, shopping, explaining choices. Perfect for A2-B1 learners building practical communication skills.

questions.sentence: Je ne peux pas venir ce soir ___ je dois garder les enfants.
questions.explanation: 'Parce que' (because) explains the reason why you can't come.
questions.translation: I can't come tonight because I have to watch the kids.

questions.sentence: Tu veux aller au cinéma ___ au restaurant ?
questions.explanation: 'Ou' (or) presents a choice between two alternatives.
questions.translation: Do you want to go to the cinema or to the restaurant?

questions.sentence: Il fait froid, ___ mets un manteau !
questions.explanation: 'Alors' (so/then) introduces a logical consequence or recommendation. It's cold, SO put on a coat!
questions.translation: It's cold, so put on a coat!

questions.sentence: Je voudrais ce livre, ___ il est trop cher.
questions.explanation: 'Mais' (but) expresses disappointment or limitation. You want it BUT it's too expensive.
questions.translation: I'd like this book, but it's too expensive.

questions.sentence: ___ tu as terminé ton travail, tu peux sortir.
questions.explanation: 'Quand' (when) sets a time condition. WHEN you finish your work, you can go out.
questions.translation: When you've finished your work, you can go out.

questions.sentence: Le magasin est fermé ___ c'est dimanche.
questions.explanation: 'Car' (because/for) explains the reason in a slightly more formal way than 'parce que'.
questions.translation: The shop is closed because it's Sunday.

questions.sentence: Dépêche-toi, ___ nous allons être en retard !
questions.explanation: 'Sinon' (otherwise/or else) warns about a negative consequence if action isn't taken.
questions.translation: Hurry up, otherwise we're going to be late!

questions.sentence: J'ai pris le bus, ___ le métro, ___ le train.
questions.explanation: 'Puis' (then) connects a series of sequential actions. You took the bus, THEN the metro, THEN the train.
questions.translation: I took the bus, then the metro, then the train.

questions.sentence: Il pleut beaucoup ___ les rues sont inondées.
questions.explanation: 'Donc' (so/therefore) shows a logical result. It's raining a lot, THEREFORE the streets are flooded.
questions.translation: It's raining a lot so the streets are flooded.

questions.sentence: J'adore le chocolat ___ je suis au régime.
questions.explanation: 'Mais' (but) expresses conflict between desire and reality. You love chocolate BUT you're on a diet.
questions.translation: I love chocolate but I'm on a diet.
